name: pyracantha
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a thorny bush (= with sharp points on the branches) that has red, orange, or yellow berries (= small fruits), often grown in gardens: Thorny plants such as hawthorn and pyracantha, he suggests, will form an impenetrable hedge. The focal point was a gnarled pyracantha. The pyracantha berries will last until they are eventually devoured by blackbirds in the spring.
More examplesFewer examplesPlanting hawthorn, pyracantha, holly, roses, or blackthorn will help deter criminals.The berry-bearing pyracantha also displays dense clusters of blossoms in the spring. You could use a tough, prickly climber, such as a rose or pyracantha.
